resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

   A side note: the lintr warning is totally unrelated, and I have a PR to resolve that separately: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11174

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11173#issuecomment-921860260


   > I don't see anything wrong with this, though I'll let other folks weigh in who might have used this.
   
   Nods. I found this work really helpful, so I'm happy it wasn't deleted before I happened to stumble upon it.
   
   Perhaps @pitrou has thoughts on if and where it should live on in the arrow repository. I think he collaborated/reviewed on this work.


--

pitrou commented on pull request #11173:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11173#issuecomment-921935130


   I didn't know for Tanya Schlusser :-(
   
   As for the `dev/benchmark` directory, obviously noone has been working on it for years, and we have our own benchmarking solution now. So it would only be useful for historical purposes. If this was already a page in the Sphinx docs it would be easy to move it around and still keep it visible, but as a directory lying around in a random place it doesn't strike me as terribly useful. @nealrichardson @amol- What do you think?


--

dianaclarke commented on pull request #11173:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11173#issuecomment-921953471


   An alternative would be to just rename `arrow/dev/benchmarking` to `arrow/dev/research`, so that folks continue to dig until they find the active code in `arrow/dev/archery/archery/benchmark`.
   
    


--

amol- commented on pull request #11173:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11173#issuecomment-922747566


   > I didn't know for Tanya Schlusser :-(
   > 
   > As for the `dev/benchmark` directory, obviously noone has been working on it for years, and we have our own benchmarking solution now. So it would only be useful for historical purposes. If this was already a page in the Sphinx docs it would be easy to move it around and still keep it visible, but as a directory lying around in a random place it doesn't strike me as terribly useful. @nealrichardson @amol- What do you think?
   
   Not that I have much context in detail, but in general I think that the repository should reflect how things currently work and any code/docs that doesn't apply to current state of the system is distracting or misleading for people having to understand the codebase. 
   
   Keeping historical knowledge is usually the purpose of the versioning system, so maybe we can delete the directory and add to the current benchmarking code (in a README or similar) a note that is based on the old code with a link to the revision that provides the old code.


--

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
The following directory contains a WIP that hasn't been modified in 3 years [1]:

- arrow/dev/benchmarking

The directory with benchmarking code that is currently in use is here:

- arrow/dev/archery/archery/benchmark

I was asked to answer questions about Arrow benchmarking today, and I naturally traversed into the higher level, WIP, benchmarking directory, but the one in use is nested deeper. Perhaps it's time to remove the WIP directory.

PS. This WIP was the jumping off point for Conbench (https://github.com/conbench/conbench). Much appreciated!

[1] Sadly, the author passed away. Thank you Tanya! RIP ;(

https://www.alumni.caltech.edu/in-memoriam/2019-9-24-tanya-schlusser-bs-99-1
